content.raw:
that console message is a red herring; it occurs because there is no display detected, but it's not causing the test failure

look for the test cases that say `FAILED`, and look for the specific lines in the test that have failed expectations:

~~~
213: [  PASSED  ] 13 tests.
213: [  FAILED  ] 2 tests, listed below:
213: [  FAILED  ] PhysicsEngines/ContactSensor.ModelRemoval/1, where GetParam() = "bullet"
213: [  FAILED  ] PhysicsEngines/ContactSensor.ModelRemoval/2, where GetParam() = "simbody"
213: 
213:  2 FAILED TESTS
~~~

~~~
213: [ RUN      ] PhysicsEngines/ContactSensor.ModelRemoval/1
213: [Msg] Waiting for master.
213: [Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
213: [Msg] Publicized address: 172.17.0.4
213: [Err] [RenderEngine.cc:726] Can't open display: 
213: [Wrn] [RenderEngine.cc:93] Unable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled
213: [Wrn] [RenderEngine.cc:293] Cannot initialize render engine since render path type is NONE. Ignore this warning ifrendering has been turned off on purpose.
213: [Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:209] ServerFixture load in 0.3 seconds, timeout after 600 seconds
213: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/gazebo/test/integration/contact_sensor.cc:163: Failure
213: Expected: (j) < (5), actual: 5 vs 5
213: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/gazebo/test/integration/contact_sensor.cc:173: Failure
213: Value of: topicsCount+1
213:   Actual: 9
213: Expected: topicsCountAfter
213: Which is: 18
213: [Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:135] ServerFixture::Unload
213: [  FAILED  ] PhysicsEngines/ContactSensor.ModelRemoval/1, where GetParam() = "bullet" (5838 ms)
213: [ RUN      ] PhysicsEngines/ContactSensor.ModelRemoval/2
213: [Msg] Waiting for master.
213: [Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
213: [Msg] Publicized address: 172.17.0.4
213: [Err] [RenderEngine.cc:726] Can't open display: 
213: [Wrn] [RenderEngine.cc:93] Unable to create X window. Rendering will be disabled
213: [Wrn] [RenderEngine.cc:293] Cannot initialize render engine since render path type is NONE. Ignore this warning ifrendering has been turned off on purpose.
213: [Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:209] ServerFixture load in 0.5 seconds, timeout after 600 seconds
213: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/gazebo/test/integration/contact_sensor.cc:163: Failure
213: Expected: (j) < (5), actual: 5 vs 5
213: /var/lib/jenkins/workspace/gazebo-ci-pr_any-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/gazebo/test/integration/contact_sensor.cc:173: Failure
213: Value of: topicsCount+1
213:   Actual: 12
213: Expected: topicsCountAfter
213: Which is: 18
213: [Dbg] [ServerFixture.cc:135] ServerFixture::Unload
213: [  FAILED  ] PhysicsEngines/ContactSensor.ModelRemoval/2, where GetParam() = "simbody" (6033 ms)
~~~

then if you or whoever you assign to look into this issue can look into the test file at the line of code that failed and provide some info about why, that would be useful. In this case, the failures occur after timing loops:

* [contact_sensor.cc line 163](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/56be256c4ba911e9ffb6fece23b0c51170f6dbdf/test/integration/contact_sensor.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#contact_sensor.cc-163)
* [contact_sensor.cc line 173](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/56be256c4ba911e9ffb6fece23b0c51170f6dbdf/test/integration/contact_sensor.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#contact_sensor.cc-173)

So in this case, I would suspect that the test might be flaky. Has this failed in other runs? If it's flaky, it should be marked as such in the issue title.
